name: Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hampton Inn for 3 nights while attending convention. Great location - only 1 block from convention center. Very nice Hampton - got upgraded to corner room. Large room w/refrigerator, coffee pot & microwave. Free happy hour (beer, wine and snacks). Typical Hampton free breakfast. Lots of restaurants within walking distance - PF Changs right across the street, Melting Pot around corner, Flemings steak house 1 block away). This hotel was not one of the "official" convention hotels - but was much closer to convention center than others. Paid $189/night (which isn't bad for a down town hotel). Hotel was full (due to convention and Hurricane evacuees from Houston) - but services still first rate. Definitely would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here in September while attending our annual board meeting which was located in a resort way out of town. Being familiar with Austin I wanted to be in the thick of the best nightlight and great restaurants and didn't want to have to drive. You can't beat this location at 2nd and San Jacinto, you are with 3 to 8 blocks of all of Austin's downtown nightlife and there is lots of it. As far as the hotel, the rooms are freshly and tastefully decorated with new beds and they are very comfortable with nice linens and plenty of comfy pillows. The bathroom could be a little bigger but it is no means small and the plumbing is all updated and in good working order and very clean, plenty of towels. We were on the 9th floor, and there was no noise either from the hallway (and we were close to the elevator) as well as from outside so the rooms must be well insulated. There is no Wi-Fi on the upper floors but there is FREE high-speed internet by an Ethernet cable right on the desk and plenty of plug ins for your computer and electronic equipment. Overall it's a 9+, the only upsetting thing was the vending machines. The soda/water vending machine on our floor didn't work the 2 days we were there even after a call to the front desk, the one on the 8th floor dispensed wrong items and this is frustrating when you want a diet Coke and get a Dr. Pepper. The hotel needs to jack-up their vending service provider. I did think that for a Hampton Inn the price of nearly $200 a night was a little steep, but considering the location and the nice amenities I wouldn't call it a great value but, competitive with other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Location and comfort is top notch

likes.liked: — Free Hi Speed Wi-Fi, Great hot breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Hampton Inn for 1 night in September 2008.
reviews.title: Great location for downtown Austin!

likes.liked: — Good location so could walk everywhere

reviews.text: The hotel was easy to find and drive too, being just off the interstate, and parking was easy too. We used the valet parking at $18, which was easy, efficient and quick, but there was also adjacent self-parking at $14, although this is not associated with or recommended by the hotel.
reviews.title: Another fan of this property

likes.liked: — The location is superb... everything is in walking distance.

reviews.text: Our room was spacious, clean and well-appointed, with a large and well-equipped bathroom. We slept very well and thought that the hotel represented very good value for a city stay at a weekend.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel for the Price

likes.disliked: — The pool was tiny, but I didn't really care

reviews.text: I have become a real fan of Hapmtons in the last couple of years. Great value . I am ususally traveling by myself, so the size of the room is no big deal. The Hampton in Austin has wired and wireless internet. I used the wired and the bandwidth was OK for streaming media, etc. I sleep in a waterbed at home and the beds at Hampton are the first "normal" hotel beds I have found that I can sleep on without waking up every 15 minutes. I also have a pillow fetish and they give you so many I have never had to call down for more..I stayed here for a convention and if you cut through an alley you can be at the convention center in less than 5 minutes. The free breakfast bar has everything from "healthy choices" to artery clogging ham and eggs. Managers "happy hour" features a local Bock beer as well as Bud Lite and several wines. Walked home about 10 blocks from an entertainment venue on Sixth Street without any concern for crime, and my radar is always up. Just a great place to stay if you don't need all the expense associated with a "full service" hotel. I also screwed up my reservation and made my checkout day one day early, and the front desk just extended my stay without any BS at the same discounted rate. As far as i am concerned, great staff, great amenities, great bed, great shower, etc.
reviews.title: Love Hampton

reviews.text: I usually write fairly thorough reviews. Except here I feel like it would be an echo.
reviews.title: Believe all the other reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the other reviews are right on the money. This is really a great pick for any type of traveler that needs to be in downtown Austin.
reviews.title: Wow! Impressed!

reviews.text: This place is NOT luxurious, but it's very clean, comfortable, and inviting. I would venture to say that this is probably the #1 rated Hampton property. I am generally not a fan on the Hilton family of properties, but I would definetly return here anytime.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The only negative I can think of, is that some of the towels in my room were a bit old and frayed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Was in Austin a few days for some events, and found the Hampton to be very well located near the entertainment areas of Austin and the Capital. Many nice restaurants just across the street. The facility was very well maintained and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pleasant

reviews.text: Comfortable, modern hotel. Centrally situated very near 6th street, almost across the road from the convention centre. Very clean and quiet. Nice large bright rooms. Swimming pool. Helpful staff. Perhaps a bit pricey at weekends but it is acity centre hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, great City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good buffet style breakfast. Excellent stay.
reviews.title: Efficient, welcoming, and pleasant all round

reviews.text: Although this is a chain hotel, it is a very good hotel. Every member of the staff was very kind and helpful. The young men outside the front door were particularly helpful: their suggestions for activities in Austin were quite witty and clever. The room was quite large and comfortable. The only aspect that was anything less than excellent was the breakfast: a buffet with the attendant plastic cutlery and a rather intrusive television tuned to CNN. However, there was a free newspaper, and a balcony outside where one could escape the TV sound. However -- to give the hotel credit -- the breakfast selection was certainly better than the "bare bones" that most chain hotels offer in such circumstances.
reviews.title: Very close to convention center
perfect place to stay
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for five nights while attending a conference at the Austin Convention Center. This hotel is very conveniently located to the convention center. The rooms were typical Hampton Inn. They were clean and reasonably large. The had only wired internet in the rooms (wifi in public areas only, but it was free. They provided a typical Hampton Inn free breakfast. The pool was outside, and it was too cold to be used. There were many restaurants within walking distance, and a couple delivered "room service." There was also a coffee shop on the first floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for several days in April. The location can't be beat - wthin about 3 blocks of 6th Street and 2 blocks from the city's trolley (the 'Dillo, only $0.75). Our room was spacious and very clean. Utlized the convenient coin-op laundry. Heard great things about the free breakfast buffet but decided to go "more local" for breakfast (the South Congress Cafe was fantastic). No noise issues, good temperature control, very comfortable bed & pillows. Easy to hail a cab at the hotel, friendly staff, inexpensive soda machines, lots of elevators so the waits were short. It was nice having the wet bar & mini-fridge. For snacks,drinks,sundries etc there's a CVS a few blocks away on Congress Ave. It wasn't high on local charm per se, but for downtown Austin, the price was really good. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the downtown Austin Hampton Inn and Suites for one night this April. We wanted to stay downtown, and we knew the price would be high, just due to the location. The hotel itself wasn't that bad. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. It's just not really worth the higher prices to stay downtown. I would prefer to stay out in the suburbs for much less and either drive into the city or take a cab.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not really worth the high price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have no official self parking, only $16/day valet parking... that's in a garage connected to the building. Don't understand why you can't just park yourself there. On street parking is available and there is a lot right next door as well.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Value

reviews.text: Overall, it was clean and they served a nice breakfast. Location downtown was nice. Just not really worth the price and the parking fees.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a prime location

reviews.text: This hotel is located within easy walking distance of Sixth Street. We upgraded from a King room to a King suite for about $10 and it was worth it. The staff at the front desk and the valet ($20/day) were very friendly and helpful. The room was well sized. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet (on the fourth floor). The bathroom was not luxurious but adequate -- shower pressure was fine. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but got coffee in the breakfast room which was pleasant-the breakfast is served on the second floor and a balcony is there for people who want to eat outside in pleasant weather. (The hotel has a pool and a workout room but we didn't use either so cannot comment on those. Also, room service is from PF Changs, which is across the street...but we didn't use that either.) We had an excellent visit and would use it again in the future when planning to spend time honky tonking along Sixth Street.
reviews.title: Best complimentary breakfast I've had

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown Hotel Austin
description: The Hampton Inn & Suites Austin Downtown hotel is the perfect location to help you enjoy your downtown Austin activities. Austin is known as the 'Live Music Capitol of the World,' and we help you enjoy it by placing you right next to Sixth Street as well the University of Texas Austin and the Texas State Capitol. Our hotel brings a New Orleans style to Texas with our Bourbon Street style, fitting right in with the "Keep Austin Weird" theme.
